Articles.Content:
Deleted -----------

Edited October 13, 2013 by Warsoul
Images needed.

The textures seem too dark and dirty and too detailed for KSP, and the UVW map needs some work- look at all that ugly stretching on the top.

Other than that it looks good and I can't wait to see what comes out of this.
those parts look very low poly and the textures just look slapped on, might wanna work on adding more depth

You should go to the Creative Commons website and read what the license you are using actually means.

Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported = People can modify your work as long as credit is given and it is also licensed as sharealike, and can not be used for commercial applications.

http://creativecommons.org/
God, That reminds of someone else that mad some things, they were horrible as the textures did not even fit what they were on.
Don't forget; these faces are hidden ingame exept the engine. It's only an early alpha. Just for fun.

those parts look very low poly and the textures just look slapped on, might wanna work on adding more depth

''those parts look very low poly '' : It's my goal. For the textures; i seek for someone to do it. I'm not familiar with it.

''those parts look very low poly '' : It's my goal. For the textures; i seek for someone to do it. I'm not familiar with it.

before you try to get someone to make textures

fix the uvw map

''those parts look very low poly '' : It's my goal. For the textures; i seek for someone to do it. I'm not familiar with it.

well don't just slap textures on it.
I think you need to learn to UV.

YOUR USING THE WRONG LICENSE!!!

With your current license ANYONE can make changes to your work and repost it as long as its share alike as well, WITHOUT ASKING YOU!!!!

http://creativecommons.org/choose/

You really NEED to visit this site and learn what the different CC licenses mean.

If you don't want people to be able to modify your work you need to use :

Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivs 3.0 Unported

Thank you for the link !) I saw these license of another thread. I asked google for that but i have not really found what i needed. But thank you it's a pretty usefull site.

But i think i read somewhere i can use the old share license and mention clearly the modification you want bring to it if i want some special clause.
such a huge post for some random junk. As if anybody is gonna steal your stuff when they can make their own in 2 minutes.

Warsoul.

You are using several of my free to use sci fi textures which I released years ago on deviant art. Please, if you are going to use them - use them properly. Do not simply just slap and wrap the entire texture around the object. Since I made half of them perhaps I can assist you in using them correctly?

Edited August 15, 2013 by Devo

Warsoul.

You are using several of my free to use sci fi textures which I released years ago on deviant art. Please, if you are going to use them - use them properly. Do not simply just slap and wrap the entire texture around the object. Since I made half of them perhaps I can assist you in using them correctly?

For sure ! But i tought they was free ? I googled free sci-fi textures !

I can do better but i'm focusing on modeling for now because i'm really better on that. And i don't really like to paint or doing 2d stuffs, i almost hate that. That's why i used the UV methods i saw on youtube. Fast and simple but with some ugly faces.

But i can't say no to someone who want to teach me somes new skillz.

For sure i accept !

such a huge post for some random junk. As if anybody is gonna steal your stuff when they can make their own in 2 minutes.

Minecraft are cubics ! Simplicity and low levels of polygons was the concept of this. For the shreaded textured faces; they are hidden under each others. We simply never see it ingame. The top have an nose cone and bottom and engine. Only the engine get an ugly bottom appearing ingame. For an early Alpha; i see no point to mention that has an huge affair.

I'm working on 42 new Bodys or Pods pack right now. Thats why i have no time to work on this right now. And that's why i slap texture onto my stuff. I'm focusing on importing my model into KSP at 1st. I found the new attachments commands; but i found a bug with it : http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/45847-I-found-a-new-bug-with-my-new-parts. Giving me hard time to find why my pods change heading on flights's restart.

After i finish my Body Pack; i will see if i can find an friend or a french texturer to fix my textures. Or i can try it but i'm not betting on my UV skillz.

I planned a bunch of add-on for this series. For now i just made an fitting series 1m to Hexcraft to 1m with 12 sides fitting. The ultra minimalistic 6 sides hexseries are coming after that. And then a bunch of variations and fittings. After; all modules for making moon bases and space station.

Edited August 15, 2013 by Warsoul
I would advise starting small so you can hone your skills, going full tilt isn't going to pay.
to be brutally honest, those ships would probably look better untextured.
yours has nothing to do with simplicity or optimized poly count, yours is just plain simple badly made crap.

I saw brick walls on huge tanks, why my case is so bad ?

Idk why; skethfab don't show my smooth shader and no glossy shader. Any tips on that ?

Edited August 15, 2013 by Warsoul
I can see what you're going for, but it's rather ugly.
